creator: stefan.hedtfeld@ewe.de
text:
In <source.jar> manifest file is correctly included, in <dest.jar> only the 
default manifest file is included.
The problem is caused by weblogic.ejbc which extracts the <source.jar> to 
generate and compile stubs and "forgets" to include the original manifest file 
when repacking.

creator: stefan.hedtfeld@ewe.de
text:
Created attachment 3426
Workaround for weblogic.ejbc bug

What version of weblogic are you using? I think later versions of ejbc respect
the manifest whilst earlier version just ignored. I'd be reticient to be doing
the job of ejbc here. If you are using such a version of ejbc why not just
update the manifest with the jar task in the build file?
creator: conor@apache.org
stefan.hedtfeld@ewe.de
text:
We are using WLS 6.1 SP3, which is the latest of the 6.x Versions. The reason 
why we don't want to use the jar task is because then the jar always has to be 
updated (which consumes quite some time when updating 30 or so ejb jars). 
Inside the ejbjar task you have access to the information if an update is 
neccessary.

I've tried a simple example on WL6.1SP4 under Linux and the manifest seems OK to
me (i.e. the manifest I specified makes it into the final jar). Can you try SP4?
